problems.title: Find Number in Array using Linear Search
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A of N integers. You are also given an integer X. Your task is to find whether X exists in the array using the Linear Search algorithm.
Linear Search checks each element one-by-one from left to right until the target is found.
If X is found, print its index (0-based). If X is not present in the array, print -1.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.
The third line contains the integer X to search.

Output Format
Print a single integer: the index of X if found, otherwise -1.

Example 1
Input:
6
4 2 8 9 1 7
9

Output:
3

Explanation:
The value 9 is found at index 3 using linear search.

problems.title: Count Occurrences of an Element
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A containing N integers. You are also given an integer X. Your task is to count how many times X appears in the array.
You must use simple linear searching: traverse the array from left to right and count every match.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.
The third line contains the integer X whose occurrences you must count.

Output Format
Print a single integer: the count of X in the array.

Example 1
Input:
7
2 3 2 5 2 7 9
2

Output:
3

Explanation:
The number 2 appears three times in the array.

problems.title: Find Index of a Target Element
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A of N integers. You are also given an integer X. Your task is to find the index of X in the array using Linear Search.
Linear Search checks elements from left to right. If X is found, return its first occurrence index (0-based). If X is not found, return -1.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.
The third line contains the integer X to search.

Output Format
Print a single integer: the index of X if found, otherwise -1.

Example 1
Input:
6
4 2 8 9 1 7
8

Output:
2

Explanation:
Element 8 is found at index 2.

problems.title: Check if Even Number Exists
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A of N integers. Your task is to check whether the array contains at least one even number.
If an even number exists, print "YES". If no even number exists, print "NO".
An even number is any integer divisible by 2.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print "YES" if the array contains an even number, otherwise print "NO".

Example 1
Input:
5
1 3 5 2 7

Output:
YES

Explanation:
The number 2 is even, so the answer is YES.

problems.title: Find First Occurrence of an Element
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A of N integers. You are also given an integer X. Your task is to find the first occurrence of X in the array using Linear Search.
Linear Search checks each element one-by-one from left to right. When you find X for the first time, return its index (0-based).
If X does not exist in the array, return -1.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.
The third line contains the integer X.

Output Format
Print a single integer: the index of the first occurrence of X, or -1 if X is not found.

Example 1
Input:
7
4 2 8 2 9 2 1
2

Output:
1

Explanation:
The number 2 first appears at index 1.
